title: Websites constantly refuse to let me login using Firefox browser, but works on other browsers
content: I was not able to log into my bank account website tonight, because it kept giving me an error saying 'Feature temporarily unavailable' every time I tried. (attached) I contacted the bank Support, and they told me to clear the cache and try again, but that did not help either. I was able to get into my account using Chrome browser, but this is a constant thing with Firefox, that websites will not work properly for one reason or another, and I have to open a different browser to be able to complete my objectives. Firefox consistently complains about permissions to open websites that were working fine just this morning. Almost like it is random, or something. As well, trying to use online chat in Firefox, is a joke, and I almost religiously have to go to a different browser to chat with anybody online. I have noticed that, for around the last year or so, Firefox browser has become less and less useful,and more and more tedious to use, which is leading me to think about changing my default browser to one that is more reliable. I have been using Firefox, as my browser for many years now, and hope that it can be corrected somehow, because I do not want to switch to a different browser truthfully. I do have addons, mainly ad blockers, but if I remove all addons, the same problems remain. Am I going to have to switch to a different browser that is more consistent, if I want to be able to have reliable internet usage, until you guys get your collective acts together, or what??
creator: zlloyd2

title: History sync not working between 2 profiles
content:
Hi, I’m trying to do a sync for the first time but it’s not working. Rather than between devices, I’m trying to sync between 2 profiles on the same Mac. Is this even possible? I’m using the latest Firefox 83.0 on Catalina 10.15.7 and and I need to sync only the history from the old profile to the new one. The new one has everything I need set up except for the history (several years worth from the old profile). After opening both profiles using the about:profiles page, logging in w/ each having a different device name, and selecting History only, I ran the sync but nothing transferred. I found a log subfolder in the weave folder within the new profile folder and it shows a lengthy error report autosaved as a plain text file, but I received no error when doing the sync. It shows "FirefoxAccounts ERROR Pairing channel error: Error: WebSocket unexpectedly closed".

If I can’t sync between profiles how can I import/export just the history? I tried doing a copy/paste and drag & drop between profiles like you can with bookmarks but it didn’t work. I read that history and bookmarks, along w/ other data are both stored in the places.sqlite file, so I can’t just replace the new one w/ the old one or I will then lose things I need.
creator: shape5

title: No audio in FF
content:
Hey Firefox community,

I was watching videos on youtube using FF earlier on today and there wasn't a problem, but for some reason I'm currently not getting any sound on any website. I'm using a wireless headset and can hear the audio in steam/non-steam games, can talk to friends using discord and can play audio/video files that are stored on my HDD with no audio issues.

Here's what I've checked so far:

- Volume mixer says that FF isn't making any sound, which is odd. - I've turned off hardware acceleration as recommended on another thread, but to no avail. - I've restarted FF and my PC because sometimes it's just that simple. - I've tried other playback devices (computer headphone output, focusrite scarlett solo) and FF won't play through those either. - Just in case someone asks, youtube isn't muted.

I've isolated the problem to FF and considering that I hadn't changed any settings until after the problem occurred (hardware acceleration) I can't for the life of me figure out what might be causing this audio issue. Any help would be appreciated, but until then I'll have to use edge. *shudders*
creator: adamjohnathanlee

title: Log In Issues with Certain Websites
content: A few months ago I started having issues logging into certain websites. First, it was logging into Quickbooks. Now I can't log in to my antivirus account, which is Kaspersky. The issue is identical with both websites. I can log in to these websites if I use a different browser, like Microsoft Edge. If I try using Mozilla, the log in page will load, but after I enter my user name and password and hit the log in button the page just sits there and does nothing.

title: Is the best way to return to using FF after trying Chrome a few months and import all the bookmarks, passwords, data & etc to a new profile?
content: I did not delete FF I simply imported into Chrome all my FF data and tried Chrome. I prefer FF and want to add back into FF all the new passwords and bookmarks & etc that I created/added while using Chrome. Hence my question. And if yes, then shouldn't I totally avoid synching with my FF account as wouldn't that defeat the purpose of creating a new profile to avoid duplication?
creator: lolaiii

title: A maximized Picture-in-Picture window UN-maximizes itself and changes size.
content:
While using Picture-in-Picture (PIP), after starting video playback and maximizing it by double clicking, the PIP window will randomly change its size to reflect the aspect ratio of the video its viewing. To put it another way: lets say I have a 16:9 aspect ratio monitor and I'm watching video that is 21:9 aspect ratio, I'm going to see those "black bars" on the top and bottom of the actual video area (the content between the top/bottom bars). Well when this PIP bug I'm experiencing happens the previously maximized PIP window comes UN-maximized all on its own and locks in on the actual video area. The result is a broken PIP window showing video area w/ black bars removed stuck on the upper ~2/3 of my screen and the desktop visible behind it in the lower ~1/3.

Furthermore a secondary effect seems to be the disabling of the double-click that would normally restore a maximized window to its lesser size, aka double-clicking wont minimize I have to use the top-right [x] button to close the PIP altogether.

So far I've experienced this problem on HULU, HBOMAX, and Amazon Prime Video. This bug presents randomly at any point during playback however I do notice it happening more often during the switching of opening production credit scenes that come at the start of a movie.

Is there some setting I can apply that would just lock the PIP into a maximized state?
creator: sontst.chr

title: Video playback "Video can't be played because the file is corrupt" despite the file being perfectly fine.
content:
So I've noticed how some video files are able to be played back in Firefox. Some are not able to what so ever, for example I've created a text video using this FFPMEG command: ffmpeg -f lavfi -i testsrc=duration=10:size=1280x720:rate=30 testsrc.mp4

which created the following file: https://astolfo.nl/i/z2ada.mp4 Both the uploaded version and the local .mp4 are unable to be played back in Firefox. However opening them up in edge chromium both files play back perfectly. Besides Edge I've also confirmed it plays back nicely in MPV.

I've tried Hardware acceleration, but both having it on and off did not change the fact that these files wouldn't want to playback in Firefox. Safe mode also did not effect this issue.
creator: dapal003

title: Reinstalled Ubuntu and now my bookmarks and extensions are gone
content: I had to reinstall Ubuntu 20.04 because I removed vital Python 2 and 3 and it broke. Before doing this I was logged into my Firefox profile and should have had my bookmarks and extensions synced. I do not see any reason why this would not be the case. However, after my reinstall of Ubuntu and logging into Firefox profile all of my bookmarks and extensions are gone. I tried checking around Firefox and it only shows bookmarks and extensions from after my reinstall. I have not performed a backup since I reinstalled Ubuntu, but those bookmarks are there. So I don't understand why I can't find my old bookmarks and extensions from before my Ubuntu issue, because I was logged into my Firefox account. My Firefox account information should have been saved to my account not my computer anyway. Please help me I had a lot of important bookmarks on there, but can't remember all of them.
creator: sjschmidl

title: Use Existing Already Open Gmail Tab for Mailto
content:
Is there a way to get mailto (email links) to use an existing open Gmail tab instead of opening a new one?

about:preferences#general > Applications mailto => Use Gmail

Gmail tab is always open (and pinned)

Thanks!
creator: compupix
